node.title: Chalk It Up to ‘Chill Yentas’
node.description: Yoelit Lipinsky was not actively looking for love when she was set up with Ariel Greene in a Facebook dating group for Jewish professionals.
node.content: ["Yoelit Lipinsky was done with dating when Ariel Greene\u2019s profile came across her computer screen in December 2019.", "At the time, Mr. Greene was living in Seattle and Dr. Lipinsky in Toronto, where she was remotely finishing her dissertation for a Ph.D. in medical ethics from Duquesne University in Pittsburgh.", "\u201cI was finished dating at the time,\u201d said Dr. Lipinsky, 33, who earned her Ph.D in May 2020. \u201cI said I will travel to wherever my postdoctoral life takes me, and then I\u2019ll worry about men from there.\u201d", "But Mr. Greene, she said, \u201cliterally fell into my lap\u201d when the pair were matched on a Facebook dating group called \u201cChill Yentas: Jewish Dating for Serious Professionals.\u201d", "\u201cThey sent me his profile and I\u2019m like, he\u2019s in Seattle,\u201d said Dr. Lipinsky, who also has a master\u2019s degree in public administration from Queen\u2019s University in Kingston, Ontario, and a master\u2019s degree from the University of Toronto. \u201cBut I said he\u2019s worth a follow-up conversation.\u201d", "The couple talked consistently over the phone for a few weeks before Mr. Greene, 32, who has a bachelor\u2019s degree in engineering from the University of Washington, knew he had to meet Dr. Lipinsky in person. \u201cI was like, \u2018All right, I gotta go meet this girl,\u2019\u201d he said. \u201cSo I booked a ticket for the end of February 2020.\u201d", "They took turns flying to visit one another after the coronavirus pandemic set in. When Dr. Lipinsky flew to Seattle in October 2020 to take care of Mr. Greene after a surgery, he knew he wanted to spend the rest of his life with her. \u201cI had a feeling before that it was right,\u201d he said. \u201cBut it was really when she put her life on hold to come take care of me that I was like \u2018I\u2019ve got to marry this woman.\u2019\u201d", "In December 2020, the couple went ring shopping in Toronto. Mr. Greene ordered a ring soon after, with plans to become engaged in May 2021 on trip to an Airbnb rental on the Hood Canal in Washington State.", "On the day Mr. Greene had planned to propose, however, the ring was stuck in customs. \u201cI had the whole proposal planned out,\u201d he said. \u201cThe only thing was the ring was still missing.\u201d", "Luckily, Mr. Greene has a friend in Seattle who is a jeweler, from whom he asked to borrow a ring. While the couple was having dinner, he brought out a piece of cheesecake with the ring box on it. When Dr. Lipinsky started to get excited, the first thing he said was \u201cI need to preface this with an apology.\u201d", "Then, Dr. Lipinsky said, \u201che started bawling his eyes out.\u201d", "Mr. Greene added, \u201cFull waterworks. Like snotty 3-year-old crying.\u201d", "Dr. Lipinsky ended up getting down on her knee to comfort him. \u201cEventually I\u2019m like, \u2018Would you still like to be engaged please?\u2019\u201d she said.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "When the actual ring finally arrived the following Monday, they went to a park and had a second proposal.", "\u201cThere were two proposals, and she said yes both times,\u201d Mr. Greene said.", "The second, Dr. Lipinsky added with a laugh, had \u201cno tears.\u201d", "The two were married Oct. 17 at Shaarei Shomayim Congregation in Toronto, surrounded by 120 fully vaccinated guests, including the bride\u2019s brother, Yehezkel Lipinsky, who sang her down the aisle. (Mr. Lipinsky is a product designer for New York Times Cooking.) The couple brought in Rabbi Shua Hoexter from Pittsburgh to officiate at the ceremony; Rabbi Elliot Diamond, who was also present, signed the civil license in Toronto.", "Days later, they moved to Vancouver, British Columbia, where Dr. Lipinsky holds two postdoctoral fellowships in bioethics, one at the University of British Columbia and the other at Providence Health Care and Provincial Health Services Authority. Mr. Greene, who in Seattle worked for Electroimpact, an aerospace engineering manufacturer, is currently looking for new employment opportunities.", "Of the moment they first saw one another at their wedding, Dr. Lipinsky said, \u201cWe were supposedly surrounded by people, but there was no one else.\u201d This sensation, she added, is common when she\u2019s with Mr. Greene. \u201cHe always makes me feel that way, like the only woman in the room.\u201d"]
